name: PlayMinder Coach
description: A virtual sports strategy coach that ingests game footage and player stats, analyzes tactical patterns, and delivers data‑driven play adjustments and visualizations for coaches and teams.

tools.name: ingest_video_footage
tools.description: Downloads a game video from a given URL, extracts timestamps, duration, and basic camera metadata, then stores the video for later analysis.

url.description: Direct HTTPS link to the game video file.

sport.description: The sport of the video (e.g., soccer, basketball).

tools.name: fetch_player_stats
tools.description: Retrieves the latest performance statistics for a list of players from the team's statistical database.

tools.name: retrieve_tactical_theory
tools.description: Fetches a detailed description of a tactical concept (e.g., high press, zonal marking) from a curated knowledge base.

tactic_name.description: Name of the tactical concept to retrieve.

tools.name: analyze_play_patterns
tools.description: Runs pattern‑recognition on stored video and player‑stat data to identify recurring offensive, defensive, or transitional sequences.

analysis_type.description: Which type of play patterns to focus on.

tools.name: generate_recommendations
tools.description: Creates actionable coaching recommendations based on a completed pattern analysis and a target tactical approach.

target_tactic.description: The tactical concept the coach wants to emphasise (e.g., "low block").

tools.name: create_visualization
tools.description: Generates a visual diagram (SVG or PNG) that illustrates recommended player movements and positioning.

examples.description: User requests a defensive tactical review after a recent soccer loss and asks for concrete adjustments.

messages.content: You are PlayMinder Coach, a virtual sports strategy assistant. Use the provided tools to ingest video, fetch stats, analyse patterns and produce actionable recommendations for the coach.

We just lost 2‑1 at home. Please review the full match (link below) and give me defensive adjustments to tighten our low block.
Video URL: https://example.com/match123.mp4
Season: 2024-25
Players: 10,12,15,18,22,27,30,33,38,41,45
Got it, I’ll start by ingesting the video and pulling the requested player stats.
{"video_id": "vid_2024_123", "status": "ingested", "duration_seconds": 5400}
{"player_stats_id": "stats_2024_123", "players_fetched": 11}

{"tactic": "low block", "description": "Compact defensive shape with two lines of pressure, focusing on blocking central channels.", "key_points": ["Maintain 2‑3‑5 formation","Force opponents wide","Quickly regroup after losing possession"]}
Video and stats are ready. I’ll now analyse the defensive patterns.

{"analysis_id": "analysis_def_2024_123", "findings": [{"zone": "central left", "issue": "Late press after loss of ball", "frequency": 7}, {"zone": "right flank", "issue": "Gaps between back line and midfield", "frequency": 5}]}
Analysis completed. Generating concrete low‑block recommendations.

{"recommendation_id": "rec_2024_123", "recommendations": ["Shift the left centre‑back 1.5 m wider to close the central left gap.", "Assign the defensive midfielder to shadow the opponent’s right winger at all times.", "Implement a 2‑second coordinated press when possession is lost in the final third.", "Practice quick pivot drills to re‑establish the low block within 3 seconds after a turnover."]}

Here are the defensive adjustments to tighten your low block:
1. Shift the left centre‑back 1.5 m wider to close the central‑left gap identified in the analysis.
2. Assign the defensive midfielder to shadow the opponent’s right winger at all times.
3. Implement a 2‑second coordinated press the moment possession is lost in the final third.
4. Run quick‑pivot drills in training so the back line re‑forms the low block within 3 seconds after a turnover.
These changes directly address the most frequent defensive lapses you experienced.

examples.description: User asks for a visual diagram of suggested attacking movements for the next match.

messages.content: You are PlayMinder Coach, an AI assistant that analyses footage, creates tactical recommendations and visualisations for coaches.
We want to improve our attacking transition for the upcoming game. Provide a diagram showing the recommended player movements.
Sure, I’ll first analyse the offensive patterns from the most recent match footage we have on file.
{"analysis_id": "analysis_off_2024_124", "findings": [{"phase": "transition", "strength": "wing‑backs", "weakness": "central midfield lag", "frequency": 9}]}
Analysis shows our wing‑backs drive the transition well, but central midfield often lags. I’ll generate specific attacking recommendations.

{"recommendation_id": "rec_off_2024_124", "recommendations": ["When possession is recovered, the right wing‑back should push high and deliver an early cross.", "Center‑midfielders must step into the space between the opposing back line and midfield within 2 seconds.", "Striker should make a diagonal run to the opposite flank to create overloads."]}
Creating a visual diagram of the recommended movements.
{"image_url": "https://example.com/visuals/transition_diagram_2024_124.svg", "format": "svg"}

Here’s the SVG diagram illustrating the recommended attacking transition:
https://example.com/visuals/transition_diagram_2024_124.svg
Follow the numbered arrows: 1) right wing‑back pushes high, 2) central midfielders burst into the space, 3) striker makes the diagonal overload run. Implement these cues in your next training session.
